oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Benjamin Franklin Sheppard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Post-war photograph of Pvt. Benjamin Franklin Sheppard of Monroe, La. He enlisted in the 4th La. Inf. Battn., CSA and was discharged in 1861. He enlisted in the 13th La. Partisan Ranger Battn., CSA and was captured. The prison train was derailed in Sumner; County, Tenn. At that point he joined Ellis Harper's Indep. Scout Co., CSA. After the war he married Eudora Jane Fitts of Templo, Tenn. They lived near Hartsville, Trousdale County, Tenn. Both are buried in the Gallatin City Cemetery.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sheppard, Benjamin Franklin
